Title: Initializer reentrancy may lead to double initialization
Description: Initializer functions that are invoked separate from contract creation (the most prominent example being minimal proxies) may be reentered if they make an untrusted non-view external call. Once an initializer has finished running it can never be re-executed.
NotImpacted: All versions before 3.2.0, all versions starting from 4.4.1
